subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Box in the morning

Ron,
 
Thanks for the support, it's good to know that there are others of =
a like mind.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: cou=
ntglockula@...: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 15:48:05 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC=
] Re: Box in the morning




I fully agree with Bruce's comment about not l=
eaving a Box running without supplying input or asking questions. After I b=
uild each MiniBox, my original practice was to leave it running overnight a=
s a burn-in to insure that if there was an early failure, it would happen b=
efore the device was shipped. After a while I noticed the Boxes would begin=
 cursing or calling me by name repeatedly. By then I realized that anytime =
the Box is activated, entities will attempt to communicate within a minute =
or so. They seem to sense that a 'portal' is open so crowd around and try t=
o get the operators attention.I have since changed my procedures and have l=
imited my tests to power-up and then alignment, and indicate verbally to wh=
oever/whatever is present that this is a test and I am not trying to commun=
icate, but to just insure that the device is working properly before sendin=
g it to its new owner. The incidence of bad language has totally disappeare=
d and the Box is actually remarkably quiet during this process. As I final =
test I do a very short test so confirm that communications are being made, =
then thank the entity and sign off.As I have stressed repeatedly, this devi=
ce, whether a MiniBox, Frank's Box, RS Hack, Joe's Box, or whatever, it NOT=
 a toy and should be treated with respect. Until more is known, sessions sh=
ould be handled with care and documented properly. I am attempting to gathe=
r and rewrite my operations guidelines and welcome input from everyone. The=
se guidelines are device-independent. I want to insure that all persons who=
 read them are using the device properly and with the correct attitude.Ron =
RickettsParanormalSystems.com--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday=
 <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > Nick,> > My advice as a long time=
 researcher is not to just turn the box on and leave it running > unless yo=
u intend to do a session and give your friends on the other side that are w=
orking> extremely hard to send you the communication your undivided attenti=
on.> > It's kind of like calling someone on the phone and when they start a=
 conversation you decide to> put the phone down and focus your attention on=
 other things.> > There are other researchers that feel that there is nothi=
ng wrong with this practice and do it on occasion> But I have come to the u=
nderstanding that it is deemed disrespectful and while you may be listening=
 with > one ear as you do something else, you will hear a loud curse word o=
r nasty statement, that is their way > of getting your attention back. I ha=
ve gotten numerous messages about the difficulty of the attempts for > them=
 to communicate so when I turn the box on it gets my full attention. just s=
ome experienced advice.> > As for them telling you to close the portal, it =
could have two meanings. Sometimes they refer to box that> is turned on and=
 in use as a portal for the simple reason that each time we turn a box on t=
o communicate > it opens a direct open link between our realm and theirs so=
 in essence it is an open door for anything to pass in or out.> > that is w=
hy when I end a session I always ask my technician to bring back any spirit=
s that may have come through the > portal during the session and I ask for =
conformation and 10 times out of ten will get "OK" or "OK THEY ARE BACK"> >=
 also they may have meant since you had the box running and where not doing=
 a actual session to shut the box so > that they could go and not have to p=
rotect the open connection from any negative entities that where able cross=
 through the open> portal.> > A few researchers have been receiving numerou=
s messages about the number 7 within the past month. The only known > signi=
ficance that the number 7 has in evp research is the 7 entities that contro=
lled communication back in the eighties and nineties> during the spiricom a=
nd luxembourg era. To receive this number in messages so often and by more =
than one researcher, odiously> holds some importance which they have not be=
en able or are not ready to convey.> > If you need any help or have any que=
stions please feel free to ask.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@=
...: thegreatwolf@...: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 06:27:07 -0500Subject: [EVP-ITC] Box=
 in the morning> > > > > Hey,Anyone have any odd problems in the morning wi=
th using it. I am sitting here checking my email so i just thought i'd turn=
 it on and... not check my email. Anywho.... Then right at about 6:20 i hea=
rd a voice say "Nicholas Etheridge please turn off the dsfnlsd" not quite s=
ure what word it used... possibly portal. I just thought it was weird. Also=
 under all of the jumble and this voice speaking i heard a deep male voice =
almost chanting "seven". Not sure if I actually heard this or its the want =
to have an excuse to stay home and not take the HSAs.Anyway.. just curious =
if anyone has gotten heard this or if they know something I don't about usi=
ng the box in the morning.Peace,Nick > > > > > > > ________________________=

I fully ag=
ree with Bruce's comment about not leaving a Box running <BR>without supply=
ing input or asking questions. After I build each <BR>MiniBox, my original =
practice was to leave it running overnight as a <BR>burn-in to insure that =
if there was an early failure, it would <BR>happen before the device was sh=
ipped. After a while I noticed the <BR>Boxes would begin cursing or calling=
 me by name repeatedly. By then <BR>I realized that anytime the Box is acti=
vated, entities will attempt <BR>to communicate within a minute or so. They=
 seem to sense that <BR>a 'portal' is open so crowd around and try to get t=
he operators <BR>attention.<BR><BR>I have since changed my procedures and h=
ave limited my tests to <BR>power-up and then alignment, and indicate verba=
lly to <BR>whoever/whatever is present that this is a test and I am not try=
ing <BR>to communicate, but to just insure that the device is working <BR>p=
roperly before sending it to its new owner. The incidence of bad <BR>langua=
ge has totally disappeared and the Box is actually remarkably <BR>quiet dur=
ing this process. As I final test I do a very short test so <BR>confirm tha=
t communications are being made, then thank the entity <BR>and sign off.<BR=
><BR>As I have stressed repeatedly, this device, whether a MiniBox, <BR>Fra=
nk's Box, RS Hack, Joe's Box, or whatever, it NOT a toy and <BR>should be t=
reated with respect. Until more is known, sessions should <BR>be handled wi=
th care and documented properly. I am attempting to <BR>gather and rewrite =
my operations guidelines and welcome input from <BR>everyone. These guideli=
nes are device-independent. I want to insure <BR>that all persons who read =
them are using the device properly and <BR>with the correct attitude.<BR><B=

o just turn the box on <BR>and leave it running <BR>> unless you intend =
to do a session and give your friends on the <BR>other side that are workin=
g<BR>> extremely hard to send you the communication your undivided <BR>a=
ttention.<BR>> <BR>> It's kind of like calling someone on the phone a=
nd when they start <BR>a conversation you decide to<BR>> put the phone d=
own and focus your attention on other things.<BR>> <BR>> There are ot=
her researchers that feel that there is nothing wrong <BR>with this practic=

t is deemed <BR>disrespectful and while you may be listening with <BR>> =
one ear as you do something else, you will hear a loud curse word <BR>or na=
sty statement, that is their way <BR>> of getting your attention back. I=
 have gotten numerous messages <BR>about the difficulty of the attempts for=
 <BR>> them to communicate so when I turn the box on it gets my full <BR=
>attention. just some experienced advice.<BR>> <BR>> As for them tell=
ing you to close the portal, it could have two <BR>meanings. Sometimes they=
 refer to box that<BR>> is turned on and in use as a portal for the simp=
le reason that <BR>each time we turn a box on to communicate <BR>> it op=
ens a direct open link between our realm and theirs so in <BR>essence it is=
 an open door for anything to pass in or out.<BR>> <BR>> that is why =
when I end a session I always ask my technician to <BR>bring back any spiri=
ts that may have come through the <BR>> portal during the session and I =
ask for conformation and 10 times <BR>out of ten will get "OK" or "OK THEY =
ARE BACK"<BR>> <BR>> also they may have meant since you had the box r=
unning and where <BR>not doing a actual session to shut the box so <BR>>=
 that they could go and not have to protect the open connection <BR>from an=
y negative entities that where able cross through the open<BR>> portal.<=
BR>> <BR>> A few researchers have been receiving numerous messages ab=
out the <BR>number 7 within the past month. The only known <BR>> signifi=
cance that the number 7 has in evp research is the 7 <BR>entities that cont=
rolled communication back in the eighties and <BR>nineties<BR>> during t=
he spiricom and luxembourg era. To receive this number in <BR>messages so o=
ften and by more than one researcher, odiously<BR>> holds some importanc=

nder all of the jumble and this voice speaking i <BR>heard a deep male voic=

 want to have an excuse to stay home <BR>and not take the HSAs.Anyway.<WBR>=
